You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Bot-Enabled Page Content

Because search engine bots don't care about all the possible content on a particular page, the bot-enabled storefront pages contain only the most search-relevant details. This content includes page-specific content and information from common page components, such as menus and breadcrumbs.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
Content Common to All Bot-Enabled Pages

All bot-enabled pages include content from the following components.

COMPONENT	CONTENT INCLUDED
Header and menu	

Content from the page header for a guest user, including:

Links to the Login page and Shopping Cart page
Menus and menu items in the navigation bar, rendered as a flat list

If you set up friendly URLs, the menu URLs use the friendly URLs you specify for categories.


Breadcrumb	Google-aware breadcrumb markup that shows the page’s breadcrumb trail.
Category tree	The most recently cached category tree. To keep the category tree up to date when you change category data, refresh the site index and category tree cache.
Footer	Content from a CC Rich Contents record that has a ContentKey value of static_footer_seo and that’s assigned to your storefront.
Promotions on Bot-Enabled Pages
NOTE Promotions are supported for bot-enabled pages only in B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) or later.

If you've set up promotions, the bot-enabled pages include any promotion images and destination URLs that meet the following criteria:

PROMOTION SETTING	BOT-ENABLED HOME PAGE	BOT-ENABLED PRODUCT LIST PAGE1	BOT-ENABLED PRODUCT DETAIL PAGE
Link Type is Product			
Link Type is Category			
Location is Splash			
Location is Banner			
Location is Left Nav			
Location is Right Nav			
NOTE If you set up friendly URLs, the promotions that link to a product or category use the product's or category's friendly URL values.
Bot-Enabled Home Page
NOTE The bot-enabled Home page is available only in B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) or later.

The bot-enabled Home page includes most content from the standard Home page, including promotions where Location Type is Splash and any spotlight or featured products.

The bot-enabled Home page also serves the following metadata in the page <head>:

TAG	SOURCE
<title>	SEO Title Site and SEO Title Detail fields in the storefront’s general settings
content attribute of <meta name="description">	SEO Description field in the storefront’s general settings
content attribute of <meta name="keywords">	SEO Keywords field in the storefront’s general settings
Bot-Enabled Product List Page

The bot-enabled Product List page is actually a set of pages with pagination controls that relate each page to the set. Each page in the set indicates to the search engine bot that its content relates to another Product List page’s content. Each page includes the following tags in the page <head>:

<link rel="prev" href="pageURL&page=previousPageURL">
<link rel="next" href="pageURL&page=nextPageURL">
NOTE If you set up friendly URLs, the href values use your friendly URL values.

The bot-enabled Product List page also serves the following metadata in the page <head>:

TAG	SOURCE
<title>	SEO Title Site and SEO Title Detail fields in the storefront’s general settings
content attribute of <meta name="description">	SEO Description field in the storefront’s general settings
content attribute of <meta name="keywords">	SEO Keywords field in the storefront’s general settings
NOTE
The bot-enabled Product List page applies only to category results.
Only version 2.0 of the Product List page supports the bot-enabled page.
The bot-enabled Product List page for category results is limited to the first 2000 products assigned to the category.
In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10), the bot-enabled Product List page sorts results only by Sequence. If storefront users sort the standard Product List page by any other value, the results on your bot-enabled page don’t match your standard page.
In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) or later, the bot-enabled and standard Product List page sort results by whichever default sort option you specify.
Bot-Enabled Product Detail Page

The bot-enabled Product Detail page serves enriched content for the selected product and any applicable component or related products.

The name, SKU, media, price and currency, short and long descriptions, and specs of a selected product.
The name, SKU, and a link to any component products, if the selected product is a bundle, kit, or dynamic kit.
The name, SKU, and a link to any related products.

The bot-enabled Product Detail page also serves the following metadata in the page <head>:

TAG	SOURCE
<title>	SEO Title field on the product record
content attribute of <meta name="description">	SEO Description field on the product record
content attribute of <meta property="og:description">	SEO Description field on the product record
content attribute of <meta name="keywords">	SEO Keywords field on the product record

The bot-enabled Product Detail page also includes structured data markup to serve to Google. The structured data enhances search results from your storefront on Google with the following information:

Breadcrumb
Short description
Price and currency
SKU
Media
SEE ALSO
Set Up Promotions for B2B Commerce for Visualforce
Serve Friendly URLs for Storefront Pages
(Google Search Developers) Breadcrumb
(Google Search Developers) Product
Configure the Sort Options Available for the Product List Page
1 Only version 2.0 of the Product List page supports the bot-enabled page.

title: Bot-Enabled Pages in Salesforce B2B Commerce
